See Bickel (1994) for a diagnosis of the group. The Madagascan
Amblypsilopus abruptus
species group shares mostly primitive characters, such as the simple cercus and surstylus, short antennae, broad face, mostly non-ornamented and non-elongated legs, unmodified wing venation, usually dark body and femora.

The
Amblypsilopus abruptus
group is widespread throughout the Old World tropics. The following Madagascan species belong to the
A. abruptus
group:
A. ankarana
,
A. cilifrons
,
A. flabellifer
,
A. kraussi
,
A. madagascariensis
and
A. prysjonesi
.
Amblypsilopus cilifrons
is reported also from DR Congo , Kenya , Namibia , Nigeria and Togo .
Amblypsilopus prysjonesi
is known only from the type locality on the Seychelles islands (Aldabra).
